page.title: 04GEOLOGY
page.content: Canna consists mainly of basaltic lava flows, with some interbedded coarse conglomerate and agglomerate, which has been intruded by dolerite sills that have cooled in sheets parallel to the flows.This has produced the island's terraced topography.Regular polygonal columns have formed providing a very distinctive scene. Around the coast there are some natural arches and stacks which have in the past provided sites for forts for the population and are currently popular as nesting sites for birds. Compass Hill is so named because it has a magnetic field that effects compass readings. Wild flowers The island is a mass of colour from May to September with a range of wild flowers, some of which are rare.
